inclusion.criterion: active myofascial trigger point in upper trapezius muscle
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: palpation of the left lower quadrant causes pain on the right

inclusion.criterion: painful limitation of neck lateral flexion range to opposite side of affected muscle
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: pain worsened in intensity and became sharp in the morning

exclusion.criterion: participants with pain pattern which is similar to pain of trigger point due to any other reason not related myofascial trigger points
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: any trauma to cervical spine (whiplash injury) or any cervical spine surgery
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: temperature is within the normal limits with normal vital signs

exclusion.criterion: cervical myeloma, complex regional pain syndrome, thoracic outlet syndrome
exclusion.label: unknown
not_met
exclusion.evidence: lab work is remarkable for leukocytosis

notes: The patient has abdominal pain due to a distended appendix with thickened appendiceal wall without perforation, abscess or gangrene. She is a candidate for laparoscopic appendectomy under general anesthesia.
